newsitem.title: USA: Calif. to sell land to Sun Microsystems.
newsitem.headline: Calif. to sell land to Sun Microsystems.

text.p: California has agreed to sell 82.5 acres of state land in Santa Clara to Sun Microsystems Inc for use as a new research and development facility, Gov. Pete Wilson said on Monday.
The state said the sale would be completed in September after entitlements for the property have been obtained from the city of Santa Clara.
The purchase price was not disclosed.
"This is a win-win for taxpayers and for Sun," Wilson, a Republican, said in a statement. "The state is selling surplus land while helping create jobs."
The city of Santa Clara, the California Trade and Commerce Agency and the California Department of General Services worked closely with Sun officials on the transaction.
Sun's proposed research and development campus will contain more than one million square feet of office space and could accommodate up to 3,600 workers.
Based in Mountain View, Calif., Sun is a leading provider of hardware, software and services for computer networks.
